flawed_nl_solution:
John runs 100-4=<<100-4=96>>96 meters once he reaches his max speed
He runs it in 13-1=<<13-1=12>>12 seconds
So he runs at a speed of 96/12=<<96/12=8>>8 m/s
So that means James's top speed is 8+2=<<8+2=6>>6 m/s
He has to run 100-10=<<100-10=90>>90 meters at his top speed
So he runs that at 90/6=<<90/6=15>>15 seconds
So he takes 15+2=<<15+2=17>>17 seconds to run 100 meters
#### 17

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 10, not 6. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
